title: 112_hr4118
content: The "Small Business Procurement Improvement Act of 2012" aims to increase small business participation in multiple award contracts. The "Small Business Procurement Improvement Act of 2012" aims to increase small business participation in multiple award contracts by requiring the inclusion of small business concerns and making full use of set-aside programs. The "Small Business Procurement Improvement Act of 2012" aims to increase small business participation in multiple award contracts through an Agency Outreach Program that includes awareness, education, and assistance for small businesses to be listed on multiple award contracts. The "Small Business Procurement Improvement Act of 2012" aims to assist small businesses in getting listed on multiple award contracts and track their participation in such contracts. The "Small Business Procurement Improvement Act of 2012" aims to assist small businesses in getting listed on multiple award contracts and track their participation in such contracts. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS. The Small Business Act is amended to include various types of contracts such as Federal Supply Schedule program contracts, multi-agency contracts, and Government-wide acquisition contracts. Additionally, the term "blanket Purchase Agreement" is defined in the Act. The Small Business Act is amended to include definitions for "blanket purchase agreement" and "basic ordering agreement" based on specific sections of the Code of Federal Regulations. SEC. 4 amends the Small Business Act to establish Government-wide goals for task orders placed against multiple award contracts awarded to various small business concerns. SEC. 5 focuses on improvements to the Small Business Reserve. Section 15(j) of the Small Business Act is amended to increase the monetary limit to $200,000 and includes regulations for task orders placed against multiple award contracts, including those under the Federal Supply Schedule program. The Administrator will ensure correct size standards are applied to each task order within 120 days of the Act's enactment. The Administrator of the General Services Administration will ensure that the non-manufacturer rule, subcontracting provisions, and correct size information for small businesses are implemented at the task order level. SEC. 6. Small Business Representation on the Federal Acquisition Regulatory Council is amended to include the Administrator of the Small Business Administration. In cases of an equal vote, the Administrator of the Office of Federal Procurement Policy will have the deciding vote.
